Description: CD3 bispecific antibodies have shown transformational clinical activity in the treatment of hematological malignancies, but the efficacy in the treatment of solid tumors has been more modest. Several factors may contribute to the limited effectiveness of T cell bispecific antibodies in solid tumor treatment. Some of the key challenges include lack of tumor specific targets, limited number of T cells in tumors, immunosuppressive TME and lack of co-stimulation. The session reviews recent clinical advances in targeting solid tumors as well as ongoing strategies aiming to enhance activity and safety of CD3-bispecifics in solid tumors.
Location: Room 6 CF - Upper Level - Convention Center
